thread.title: Florence + The Machine makes a Portland crowd its choir (Photos)
thread.title_full: Florence + The Machine makes a Portland crowd its choir (Photos) | OregonLive.com

author: Kristyna Wentz-Graff | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Florence + The Machine makes a Portland crowd its choir (Photos)
text:
The the UK band Florence + The Machine continued their expanded US tour, stopping off in Portland Saturday night for a show at Veterans Memorial Coliseum.
Front woman Florence Welch passed by fans at the front of the auditorium, shaking hands and waving before taking center stage.
The band opened with "What The Water Gave Me," from their 2001 release, Ceremonials. Through the fan's screams, they segued right into "Ship to Wreck" from their newest album, "How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful."
Welch danced and twirled across the stage barefoot, a whirling vision in white accented by her fiery red hair.
After the first two songs, Welch greeted the crowd, and said the band would like to have brought a choir with them but wasn't sure they could fit them on the stage.
"So I was wondering this evening, if you would be our choir?" she asked. "Could we sing this one together?" The crowd answered with ecstatic screams as Welch directed the "choir" through "Shake It Out."
The group continues their fall tour, heading to Vancouver, BC for the next show.
-- Kristyna Wentz-Graff
@kwgphoto
